 cellspacing=3D"0" cellpadding=3D"0" id=3D"av"><tr><td><div id=3D"au"><a na=
me=3D"" id=3D"at">Today's Top Stories</a></div></table><div id=3D"v"><div i=
d=3D"p"><a id=3D"o" name=3D"n112993"></a>Changing Course: PE Pivots Away fr=
om B2C Education, Toward B2B </div></div><div id=3D"s"><div id=3D"t"><input=
 type=3D"hidden" value=3D"WZPAW7R7MSKWA"/><table cellpadding=3D"0" cellspac=
ing=3D"0"><tr><td><div id=3D"r"> SHARE: </div><td><div id=3D"c"><a id=3D"e"=
 href=3D"https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253361.345909" target=3D"_blank">=
<img id=3D"d" src=3D"http://marketo.pitchbook.com/rs/pitchbook/images/smem.=
gif"></a></div><td><div id=3D"c"><a id=3D"e" href=3D"https://my.pitchbook.c=
om/n/9759.1253362.345909" target=3D"_blank"><img id=3D"d" src=3D"http://mar=
keto.pitchbook.com/rs/pitchbook/images/smtw.gif"></a></div><td><div id=3D"c=
"><a id=3D"e" href=3D"https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253363.345909" targe=
t=3D"_blank"><img id=3D"d" src=3D"http://marketo.pitchbook.com/rs/pitchbook=
/images/smin.gif"></a></div><td><div id=3D"c"><a id=3D"e" href=3D"https://m=
y.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253364.345909" target=3D"_blank"><img id=3D"d" src=
=3D"http://marketo.pitchbook.com/rs/pitchbook/images/smfb.png"></a></div></=
table></div></div><table cellspacing=3D"0" cellpadding=3D"0" width=3D"395" =
id=3D"u"><tr><td id=3D"q"><table cellspacing=3D'0' cellpadding=3D'0'><tr><t=
d id=3D"k"><span id=3D"n">Private equity firms have been shying away from B=
2C-focused educational services companies recently, according to the PitchB=
ook Platform, and instead have concentrated on educational services compani=
es in the B2B market.<br><br> Since the start of 2007, <a id=3D"g" href=3D'=
https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253365.345909' target=3D'blank'>300 U.S.- =
or Canada-based companies in the education industry</a> have brought in PE =
capital. Between 2009 and 2013, investors pivoted away significantly from t=
he B2C services corner of the industry; in 2009, B2C investments accounted =
for 72% of the year's overall education-focused activity, but that percenta=
ge was pared down every year until 2013, when B2C accounted for only 29%. P=
ut another way, activity whittled down from the 34 deals that were recorded=
 in B2C companies in 2009 to only 11 deals last year, a 68% decrease in fiv=
e years.<br><br>Compare that to B2B-focused educational services deals, whi=
ch accounted for only 17% of the year's education-focused activity in 2009,=
 but their share increased every year until 2013, when they accounted for 6=
1%. The deal count also grew incrementally every year from 2009 (eight deal=
s) until 2013, almost tripling at 23. There's been a noticeable increase in=
 the attention paid to training services providers, perhaps due to increase=
s in government regulations and stricter standards for business practices.<=
table width=3D'100%' cellpadding=3D'0' cellspacing=3D'0'><tr><td align=3D'c=
enter'><table cellpadding=3D"4" cellspacing=3D"4" align=3D"center" id=3D"cd=

ssance Learning</a>, an educational assessment and learning analytics compa=
ny, from <a id=3D"g" href=3D'https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253373.345909=
'>Permira</a> for $1.1 billion. Renaissance provides a variety of education=
al tools and products, ranging from cloud-based assessment software to acce=
lerated reading programs. It also provides training to teachers and adminis=
trators, among other services.<br><br>Permira, which took Renaissance priva=
te in 2011 for about $455 million, could reportedly reap a 4x return on its=
 original investment. The agreement comes less than a month after <a id=3D"=
g" href=3D'https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253374.345909'>Google Capital</=
a> invested $40 million in the company at a $1 billion valuation. Google Ca=
pital is expected to remain an investor in the company.</span><tr><td id=3D=

><td align=3D"right" id=3D"ap"><tr><td align=3D"left" id=3D"aq"></table></t=
able><a id=3D"g" href=3D'https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253396.345909'>Ba=
y Grove Capital</a>'s <a id=3D"g" href=3D'https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1=
253397.345909'>Lineage Logistics</a> has agreed to acquire <a id=3D"g" href=
=3D'https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253398.345909'>Millard Refrigerated Se=
rvices</a>, a national third party warehousing and logistics company. Linea=
ge will add 30 strategic locations through the acquisition, doubling the si=
ze of its business and creating the second largest refrigerated warehouse n=
etwork globally.</span><tr><td id=3D"k"><table cellpadding=3D"0" cellspacin=

cturer and distributor of branded wood pellets. From its three U.S. product=

e></table></table><div id=3D"al"><div id=3D"ak">&nbsp;</div></div><div id=

hana-Based GNFoods and Shop N Save </div></div><div id=3D"s"><div id=3D"t">=

llspacing=3D"0"><tr><td><div id=3D"r"> SHARE: </div><td><div id=3D"c"><a id=

tr><td id=3D"k"><span id=3D"n">U.K. investment firm <a href=3D"https://my.p=
itchbook.com/n/9759.1253434.345909" id=3D"g">Duet Group</a> has acquired co=
ntrolling stakes in Ghana-based <a href=3D"https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.=
1253435.345909" id=3D"g">Shop N Save</a> and <a href=3D"https://my.pitchboo=
k.com/n/9759.1253436.345909" id=3D"g">GNFoods</a> through a $50 million inv=
estment. Shop N Save is a supermarket joint-venture, while GNFoods makes to=
mato paste and tomato-related products. The funds will be used to open new =
food retail stores, expand manufacturing capacity and invest in sales and m=
arketing capabilities.</span><tr><td id=3D"k"><table cellspacing=3D"0" cell=

/a>Eventbrite Receives $60M in Funding, $1B Valuation </div></div><div id=
=3D"s"><div id=3D"t"><input type=3D"hidden" value=3D"INXTPQXLAFEA4"/><table=
 cellpadding=3D"0" cellspacing=3D"0"><tr><td><div id=3D"r"> SHARE: </div><t=
d><div id=3D"c"><a id=3D"e" href=3D"https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253458=

></a></div><td><div id=3D"c"><a id=3D"e" href=3D"https://my.pitchbook.com/n=

ges/smfb.png"></a></div></table></div></div><table cellspacing=3D"0" cellpa=
dding=3D"0" width=3D"395" id=3D"u"><tr><td id=3D"q"><table cellspacing=3D'0=
' cellpadding=3D'0'><tr><td id=3D"k"><span id=3D"n"><table cellpadding=3D"4=
" cellspacing=3D"4" align=3D"right" id=3D"as"><tr><td align=3D"center"><tab=
le align=3D"center" cellpadding=3D"0" cellspacing=3D"0" width=3D"1" id=3D"a=
r"><tr><td><a href=3D"https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253462.345909"><img =
src=3D"https://img.pitchbook.com/news/8616.gif" align=3D"center" id=3D"an" =
width=3D"180" /></a><tr><td align=3D"right" id=3D"ap"><tr><td align=3D"left=
" id=3D"aq"></table></table>Online ticketing platform <a id=3D"g" href=3D'h=
ttps://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253463.345909'>Eventbrite</a> has reportedl=
y raised another $60 million in funding, this time at the magical $1 billio=
n valuation. The company raised the same amount of capital in a Series F ro=
und in April 2013, garnering a $650 million valuation at the time. The new =
funds come from <a id=3D"g" href=3D'https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253464=
.345909'>Tiger Global Management</a> and <a id=3D"g" href=3D'https://my.pit=
chbook.com/n/9759.1253465.345909'>T. Rowe Price</a>, both of which invested=
 in the Series F round and supposedly initiated the new deal with an offer =
that Eventbrite couldn't pass up.<br><br> Many thought that Eventbrite was =
on a sure track to an IPO, and while that is still very much the case, the =
massive new round will likely postpone any plans to go public. Since its la=
st massive infusion, the company has been accelerating international growth=
, event discovery and product development, as well as expanding its team. O=
ther Eventbrite investors include <a id=3D"g" href=3D'https://my.pitchbook.=
com/n/9759.1253466.345909'>Sequoia Capital</a>, <a id=3D"g" href=3D'https:/=
/my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253467.345909'>Tenaya Capital</a>, <a id=3D"g" hr=
ef=3D'https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253468.345909'>DAG Ventures</a> and =
<a id=3D"g" href=3D'https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253469.345909'>SoftTec=
h VC</a>, among others.</span><tr><td id=3D"k"><table cellpadding=3D"0" cel=
lspacing=3D"0"><tr><td width=3D"187" valign=3D"top" id=3D"w"><div id=3D"a">=
<div id=3D"f"><div id=3D"ag"><a href=3D"https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.125=
3463.345909" id=3D"ai">Eventbrite</a></div></div></div><div id=3D"a"><span =
id=3D"j"> Internet Retail </span></div><div id=3D"a"><span id=3D"j"><span>M=
obile</span><br><span>SaaS</span><br></span></div><div id=3D"a"><span id=3D=
"j"> San Francisco, CA </span></div><div id=3D"a"><span id=3D"m"><a href=3D=
"https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253463.345909" id=3D"l"> $60 million </a>=
</span></div><div id=3D"a"><span id=3D"m"><a href=3D"https://my.pitchbook.c=
om/n/9759.1253463.345909" id=3D"l"> Late Stage VC </a></span></div><table c=
ellspacing=3D"0" cellpadding=3D"0" id=3D"x"><tr><td height=3D"20" id=3D"z">=

=3D"30" id=3D"ac" bgcolor=3D"#476990" cellpadding=3D"0" cellspacing=3D"0"><=

idth=3D"30" id=3D"aa"> &nbsp;<img src=3D"http://marketo.pitchbook.com/rs/pi=

bsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </a></table></table><td width=3D"28"><td width=3D"18=
7" valign=3D"top" id=3D"ah"><div id=3D"a"><div id=3D"aj">Investors</div><di=
v id=3D"f"><div id=3D"h"><a href=3D"https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253465=
.345909" id=3D"i">T. Rowe Price</a></div></div><div id=3D"f"><div id=3D"h">=
<a href=3D"https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253464.345909" id=3D"i">Tiger G=
lobal Management</a></div></div></div></table></table></table><div id=3D"al=

name=3D"n113008"></a>MuleSoft Scores $50M Round </div></div><div id=3D"s"><=

dding=3D'0'><tr><td id=3D"k"><span id=3D"n"><table cellpadding=3D"4" cellsp=

td><a href=3D"https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253474.345909"><img src=3D"h=

aq"></table></table><a id=3D"g" href=3D'https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.125=
3475.345909'>New Enterprise Associates</a>, <a id=3D"g" href=3D'https://my.=
pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253476.345909'>Lightspeed Venture Partners</a> and <a=
 id=3D"g" href=3D'https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253477.345909'>Meritech =
Capital Partners</a> have led a $50 million financing round for <a id=3D"g"=
 href=3D'https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253478.345909'>MuleSoft</a>, the =
San Francisco-based provider of an integration platform for connecting SaaS=
 and enterprise applications. Also participating in the round was new inves=
tor <a id=3D"g" href=3D'https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253479.345909'>Cis=
co</a>, as well as returning backers <a id=3D"g" href=3D'https://my.pitchbo=
ok.com/n/9759.1253480.345909'>salesforce.com</a>, <a id=3D"g" href=3D'https=
://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253481.345909'>SAP Ventures</a>, <a id=3D"g" hr=
ef=3D'https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253482.345909'>Hummer Winblad Ventur=
e Partners</a>, <a id=3D"g" href=3D'https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253483=
.345909'>Morgenthaler Ventures</a> and <a id=3D"g" href=3D'https://my.pitch=
book.com/n/9759.1253484.345909'>Bay Partners</a>. With a total of about $13=
1 million in to-date funding, MuleSoft will use the new capital to accelera=
te its global growth.<br><br>MuleSoft's platform is designed to unify busin=
ess processes across applications, data sources and APIs, giving organizati=
ons the freedom to connect what they want, when they want, whether on-premi=
ses or in the cloud. 150,000 developers use MuleSoft's platform at thousand=
s of companies from industries including healthcare, financial services, in=
surance, retail, government, media and more. The new investment gives the c=
ompany a reported $800 million valuation, more than double what it was wort=
h after a 2013 $37 million Series E round ($348 million).</span><tr><td id=

 align=3D"left" id=3D"aq"></table></table><a id=3D"g" href=3D'https://my.pi=
tchbook.com/n/9759.1253491.345909'>Banjo</a>, a highly visual app and Websi=
te that allows users to experience breaking news and live events in real ti=
me through the eyes of the people who are there, has completed a $16 millio=
n Series B financing round led by <a id=3D"g" href=3D'https://my.pitchbook.=
com/n/9759.1253492.345909'>Balderton Capital</a>, with participation from <=
a id=3D"g" href=3D'https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253493.345909'>BlueRun =
Ventures</a> and <a id=3D"g" href=3D'https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.125349=
4.345909'>Vegas Tech Fund</a>. The infusion brings Banjo's total to-date fu=
nding to $21 million and will be used to accelerate growth plans by recruit=
ing talent, expanding the company's global user base and enhancing its ente=
rprise platform for media partnerships. The company also just launched a ne=
w feature called Banjo Rewind that allows users to search past events and g=
o back to specific moments in time, providing a full historical view into w=
hat happened anytime, anywhere around the world. Banjo previously raised a =
$5 million Series A round led by BlueRun Ventures.</span><tr><td id=3D"k"><=

</a><tr><td align=3D"right" id=3D"ap">&nbsp; <tr><td align=3D"left" id=3D"a=
q">&nbsp; </table></table><a id=3D"g" href=3D"https://my.pitchbook.com/n/97=
59.1253500.345909">Rover.com</a>, an online community that connects dog own=
ers with approved and reviewed in-home dog sitters, has raised $12 million =
in Series C funding led by <a id=3D"g" href=3D"https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9=
759.1253501.345909">Menlo Ventures</a> and joined by existing investors <a =
id=3D"g" href=3D"https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253502.345909">Madrona Ve=
nture Group</a>, <a id=3D"g" href=3D"https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.125350=
3.345909">Foundry Group</a> and <a id=3D"g" href=3D"https://my.pitchbook.co=
m/n/9759.1253504.345909">Petco</a>. Menlo's <a id=3D"g" href=3D"https://my.=
pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253505.345909">Sunil Raman</a> and <a id=3D"g" href=
=3D"https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253506.345909">Venky Ganesan</a> will =
join the company's Board of Directors as part of the transaction.<br><br> R=
over, which provides an online pet services community that has over 25,000 =
sitters in the U.S. serving every major city, also offers pet insurance, ve=
t consultations, photo sharing and more. Rover last raised $10.5 million of=
 Series B funding at a $29 million valuation in July 2013 and now has a tot=
al of about $25 million of VC backing. The company will use this investment=
 to grow its employee headcount and expand its product offering.</span><tr>=

British discount retailer <a id=3D"g" href=3D'https://my.pitchbook.com/n/97=
59.1253561.345909'>Poundland</a> priced its IPO at =C2=A33 ($5.01) per shar=
e and went public, offering 125 million shares on the London Stock Exchange=
 under the symbol PLND. Based on the offer price, Poundland's market capita=
lization was =C2=A3750 million ($1.25 billion). Shares closed at =C2=A33.88=
 ($6.48) on their first day of trading on Thursday. <br><br>Poundland share=
holder <a id=3D"g" href=3D'https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.1253562.345909'>=
Warburg Pincus</a>, which reduced its stake in the offering to 37.9%, is sa=
id to have made about 4.5x on its investment. The company, which operates a=
 network of over 500 general merchandise, single-price stores in the U.K. a=
nd Ireland, was acquired for =C2=A3200 million ($334 million) in 2010 by Wa=
rburg Pincus from <a id=3D"g" href=3D'https://my.pitchbook.com/n/9759.12535=
63.345909'>Advent International</a>.</span><tr><td id=3D"k"><table cellpadd=

des on the NASDAQ under the symbol DPRX. Dipexium's main product is Locilex=
, a topical antibiotic chemically synthesized from the skin of the African =
Clawed Frog that targets mild infections of diabetic foot ulcers. The compa=

million. Shares closed at $14.04 on their debut, up 17%.</span><tr><td id=
